intro: Deinocheilos sichuanense, commonly known as the Sichuan spurge, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
